member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.SelectPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the current page of the native document.
member.param: Page number between 1 and page count.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Opens a PDF, draws a rubber stamp annotation, then displays the stamped document on a GdViewer object.

example.code: 'The following code assumes that a GdViewer called GdViewer1 has been painted on the form. Dim oGdPicturePDF As New GdPicturePDF oGdPicturePDF.LoadFromFile("test.pdf", False) Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) Dim annot As AnnotationRubberStamp = oAnnotationManager.AddRubberStampAnnot(Color.Red, 0, 0, oGdPicturePDF.GetPageWidth / 72, oGdPicturePDF.GetPageHeight / 72, "APPROVED") annot.Rotation = 20 oAnnotationManager.SaveAnnotationsToPage() oAnnotationManager.Close() GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.Close
member.summary: Closes the annotation manager object. Call this method when you are done with annotation handling of the document.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Opens a PDF, draws a rubber stamp annotation, then displays the stamped document on a GdViewer object.

example.code: 'The following code assumes that a GdViewer called GdViewer1 has been painted on the form. Dim oGdPicturePDF As New GdPicturePDF oGdPicturePDF.LoadFromFile("test.pdf", False) Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) Dim annot As AnnotationRubberStamp = oAnnotationManager.AddRubberStampAnnot(Color.Red, 0, 0, oGdPicturePDF.GetPageWidth / 72, oGdPicturePDF.GetPageHeight / 72, "APPROVED") annot.Rotation = 20 oAnnotationManager.SaveAnnotationsToPage() oAnnotationManager.Close() GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.InitFromGdPicturePDF(GdPicture12.GdPicturePDF)
member.summary: Initialize the annotation manager object from a PDF document handled by a GdPicturePDF object.
member.param: The PDF document.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Opens a PDF, draws a rubber stamp annotation, then displays the stamped document on a GdViewer object.

example.code: 'The following code assumes that a GdViewer called GdViewer1 has been painted on the form. Dim oGdPicturePDF As New GdPicturePDF oGdPicturePDF.LoadFromFile("test.pdf", False) Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) Dim annot As AnnotationRubberStamp = oAnnotationManager.AddRubberStampAnnot(Color.Red, 0, 0, oGdPicturePDF.GetPageWidth / 72, oGdPicturePDF.GetPageHeight / 72, "APPROVED") annot.Rotation = 20 oAnnotationManager.SaveAnnotationsToPage() oAnnotationManager.Close() GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.InitFromGdViewer(System.Object)
member.summary: Initialize the annotation manager object from a GdViewer object.
member.param: The GdViewer object.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Opens a PDF, laods it onto a GdViewer, initialize the AnnotationManager from the GdViewer, then draw a rubber stamp annotation.

example.code: 'The following code assumes that a GdViewer called GdViewer1 has been painted on the form. Dim oGdPicturePDF As New GdPicturePDF oGdPicturePDF.LoadFromFile("test.pdf", False) GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdViewer(GdViewer1) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) Dim annot As AnnotationRubberStamp = oAnnotationManager.AddRubberStampAnnot(Color.Red, 0, 0, oGdPicturePDF.GetPageWidth / 72, oGdPicturePDF.GetPageHeight / 72, "APPROVED") annot.Rotation = 20 oAnnotationManager.SaveAnnotationsToPage() oAnnotationManager.Close() GdViewer1.Redraw()

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.InitFromGdPictureImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize the annotation manager object from a GdPicture Image.
member.param: A GdPicture Image identifier.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Opens a multipage tiff image, drawn a rubber stamp annot, then display the stamped document into a GdViewer object

example.code: Dim oGdPictureImaging As New GdPictureImaging Dim imageId As Integer = oGdPictureImaging.CreateGdPictureImageFromFile("multipage.tif") If imageId <> 0 Then Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPictureImage(ImageID) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) Dim annot As AnnotationRubberStamp = oAnnotationManager.AddRubberStampAnnot(Color.Red, 0, 0, CSng(oGdPictureImaging.GetWidthInches(ImageID)), CSng(oGdPictureImaging.GetHeightInches(ImageID)), "APPROVED") annot.Rotation = 20 oAnnotationManager.SaveAnnotationsToPage() GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPictureImage(ImageID) Else MessageBox.Show("Error: " + oGdPictureImaging.GetStat().ToString()) End If

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.GetAnnotationCount
member.summary: Returns the number of GdPicture/XMP annotations available on the current page of the native document.
member.returns: The number of available annotations.

code.description: Displays creation data and author of all available annotations in a PDF document after displaying it in a GdViewer object.

example.code: 'The following code assumes that a GdViewer called GdViewer1 has been painted on the form. Dim oGdPicturePDF As New GdPicturePDF oGdPicturePDF.LoadFromFile("test.pdf", False) GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) For i As Integer = 0 To oAnnotationManager.GetAnnotationCount() - 1 Dim Annot As GdPicture.Annotation = oAnnotationManager.GetAnnotationFromIdx(i) MessageBox.show("Author: " + Annot.Author) MessageBox.show("Creation time: " + Annot.CreationTime.ToString) Next oAnnotationManager.Close()

member.returns: An Annotation object.

Dim oGdPicturePDF As New GdPicturePDF oGdPicturePDF.LoadFromFile("test.pdf", False) GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) For i As Integer = 0 To oAnnotationManager.GetAnnotationCount() - 1 Dim Annot As GdPicture.Annotation = oAnnotationManager.GetAnnotationFromIdx(i) MessageBox.Show("Author: " + Annot.Author) MessageBox.Show("Creation time: " + Annot.CreationTime.ToString) Next oAnnotationManager.Close()

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.GetOrderedAnnotations
member.summary: Returns an array of GdPicture/XMP annotations available on the current page of the native document, sorted by they z-order.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.SetAnnotationPropertyValue(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Changes the value of a specific annotation property by its name. This method has been initially introduced for COM interop usage. To determine properties that may be used, refer to the Annotations Namespace for the .NET edition and examine the "Properties" of each class. All annotations classes share the properties in the Annotation class and add the properties of the individual class.
member.param: The index of the annotation (0-based). Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1.
The name of the annotation property. IE: FillColor.
The new value to apply to the property.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Change to filling color of all annotations in a pdf to a semi transparent red color, then displaying it in a GdViewer object.

example.code: 'The following code assumes that a GdViewer called GdViewer1 has been painted on the form. Dim oGdPicturePDF As New GdPicturePDF oGdPicturePDF.LoadFromFile("test.pdf", False) Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) Dim annotationManager As New AnnotationManager = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationManager() For i As Integer = 0 To annotationManager.GetAnnotationCount() - 1 annotationManager.SetAnnotationPropertyValue(i, "FillColor", annotationManager.ARGBI(100, 255, 255, 255)) Next oAnnotationManager.Close() GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.GetAnnotationPropertyValue(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Get the value of a specific annotation property by its name. This method has been initially introduced for COM interop usage. To determine properties that may be used, refer to the Annotations Namespace for the .NET edition and examine the "Properties" of each class. All annotations classes share the properties in the Annotation class and add the properties of the individual class. .
member.param: The index of the annotation (0-based). Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1.
The name of the annotation property. IE: FillColor.
member.returns: The value of the specified property. An empty object is returned in case the method failed.

code.description: Displays the annotation's type and color of all available annotations in a PDF document after displaying it in a GdViewer object.

example.code: 'The following code assumes that a GdViewer called GdViewer1 has been painted on the form. Dim oGdPicturePDF As New GdPicturePDF oGdPicturePDF.LoadFromFile("test.pdf", False) GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPicturePDF(oGdPicturePDF) oAnnotationManager.SelectPage(1) For i As Integer = 0 To oAnnotationManager.GetAnnotationCount() - 1 Dim name As String = oAnnotationManager.GetAnnotationPropertyValue(i, "Name") MessageBox.Show("Name: " + name) Dim fillColor As Color = oAnnotationManager.GetAnnotationPropertyValue(i, "FillColor") MessageBox.Show("Fill Color: " + fillColor.Name.ToString()) Next oAnnotationManager.Close()

code.description: Creating a new GdPicture bitmap, adding a sticky-note annot on it and display the image on a GdViewer object.

example.code: Using Imaging As New GdPictureImaging Dim ImageID As Integer = Imaging.CreateNewGdPictureImage(1000, 1600, 32, Color.White) Using annotsMgr As New AnnotationManager annotsMgr.InitFromGdPictureImage(ImageID) Dim annot As AnnotationStickyNote = annotsMgr.AddStickyNoteAnnot(1, 1, 3, 4, "Hello World") annot.FontSize = 20 annot.Opacity = 0.7 annot.Rotation = 20 annotsMgr.SaveAnnotationsToPage() End Using GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPictureImage(ImageID) End Using

member.name: M:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.SaveAnnotationsToXMP(System.IO.Stream)

code.description: Save annotations to stream and load them back.

example.code: 'Part 1: Open image, add annot and save annotation to Stream object Dim oGdPictureImaging As New GdPictureImaging Dim ImageID As Integer = oGdPictureImaging.CreateGdPictureImageFromFile("001.tif") Dim oAnnotationManager As New AnnotationManager Dim annotStream As New IO.MemoryStream() oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPictureImage(ImageID) Dim annot As AnnotationStickyNote = oAnnotationManager.AddStickyNoteAnnot(0, 0, 3, 3, "To Be Investigated") annot.CanSelect = False annot.Author = "John" oAnnotationManager.SaveAnnotationsToXMP(annotStream) oGdPictureImaging.ReleaseGdPictureImage(ImageID) 'Part 2 open a new image and load the previously saved annotation from the Stream object ImageID = oGdPictureImaging.CreateGdPictureImageFromFile("002.tif") oAnnotationManager.InitFromGdPictureImage(ImageID) oAnnotationManager.LoadAnnotationsFromXMP(annotStream) GdViewer1.DisplayFromGdPictureImage(ImageID) 'Display the image including annotation into a GdViewer object annotStream.Dispose()

member.name: E:GdPicture12.AnnotationManager.OnCustomAnnotationPaint
member.summary: Occurs when a custom annotation must be rendered.
member.param: The custom annotation object to render.
The graphics object to render the custom annotation appearance.

remarks.para: This event is not supported by the COM Interop edition.
This event is used in the "Annotations" Demo. Please check appendix "Finding Demo Applications" for more information.
The measurement unit, for dimensions and sizes, is expressed in inches.
The rotation, if any, is handled by the component which automatically set to required transformation.

You have to render the annotation's appearance in the bounding box defined by [x, y, w, h], where x and y define the coordinates of the top-left corner of the box equal to (Annot.Left - Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2), w defines the width equal to Annot.Width and y the height equal to Annot.Height.

code.description: Rendering custom annotations.

example.code: Private Sub oAnnotationManager_OnCustomAnnotationPaint(ByVal Annot As AnnotationCustom, ByVal g As System.Drawing.Graphics) Handles oAnnotationManager.OnCustomAnnotationPaint Select Case Annot.ModelID Case 1 'triangle annotation, previously defined by the AddCustomAnnot() method. Using gp As New Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath gp.AddLine(New PointF(Annot.Left - Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top + Annot.Height / 2), New PointF(Annot.Left, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2)) gp.AddLine(New PointF(Annot.Left, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2), New PointF(Annot.Left + Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top + Annot.Height / 2)) gp.CloseFigure() g.DrawPath(New Pen(Brushes.Red, 0.1), gp) End Using Case 2 'cross annotation, previously defined by the AddCustomAnnot() method. g.DrawLine(New Pen(Brushes.Red, 0.1), New PointF(Annot.Left - Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2), New PointF(Annot.Left + Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top + Annot.Height / 2)) g.DrawLine(New Pen(Brushes.Red, 0.1), New PointF(Annot.Left - Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top + Annot.Height / 2), New PointF(Annot.Left + Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2)) End Select End Sub

member.name: M:GdPicture12.LicenseManager.RegisterKEY(System.String)
member.summary: Unlocks the toolkit with a commercial key or a demo key. You can subsequently use this method to register any Plugin or Toolkit core keys. To register a license upgrade, you have to call first this method passing the previous ordered key, then call it again with the upgrade key.
member.param: The license key.
member.returns: True if Success, else False (invalid license KEY).

code.description: Example of how to use RegisterKEY to unlock a plugin and to unlock the toolkit core with an upgrade key.

example.code: Dim LicMgr As New LicenseManager LicMgr.RegisterKEY(MY_GDPICTURENET_KEY) LicMgr.RegisterKEY(MY_PLUGIN_KEY)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.LicenseManager.GetVersion
member.summary: Returns the GdPicture source code version used in the following format M.mrr where 'M' describes the major version, 'm' the medium version and 'rr' the release number.
member.returns: The GdPicture core version.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.LicenseManager.GetRedistPath
member.summary: Returns the Redist path of the GdPicture SDK. For demonstration purpose only. Do not use this method in custom project.
member.returns: The Redist path of the GdPicture SDK.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.LicenseManager.Internal(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Do not use. Here for internal usage only.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.Dispose
member.summary: This method disposes the GdViewer object, by closing and releasing all related resources.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetAnnotationCount
member.summary: Returns the number of GdPicture/XMP annotations available on the current page of the displayed document.
member.returns: The number of available annotations.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Displays creation data and author of all available annotations

example.code: For i As Integer = 0 To GdViewer1.GetAnnotationCount() - 1 Dim Annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(i) MessageBox.show("Author: " + Annot.Author) MessageBox.show("Creation time: " + Annot.CreationTime.ToString) Next

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetAnnotationFromIdx(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a GdPicture/XMP annotations available on the current page of the displayed document.
member.returns: An Annotation object.
member.param: The index of the annotation (0-based). Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Displays creation data and author of all available annotations

example.code: For i As Integer = 0 To GdViewer1.GetAnnotationCount() - 1 Dim Annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(i) MessageBox.show("Author: " + Annot.Author) MessageBox.show("Creation time: " + Annot.CreationTime.ToString) Next

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DeleteAnnotation(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a GdPicture/XMP annotation on the current page of the displayed document.
member.param: The index of the annotation (0-based). Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Remove all available annotations

example.code: For i As Integer = 1 To GdViewer1.GetAnnotationCount() GdViewer1.DeleteAnnotation(0) Next

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetSelectedAnnotationIdx
member.summary: Returns the index of the selected GdPicture/XMP annotation.
member.returns: An Annotation object index. Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1 if an annotation is selected, else -1.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Displays creation data and author of the selected annotation

example.code: Dim AnnotationIdx as integer = GdViewer1.GetSelectedAnnotationIdx() If AnnotationIdx >= 0 Then Dim Annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(AnnotationIdx) MessageBox.show("Author: " + Annot.Author) MessageBox.show("Creation time: " + Annot.CreationTime.ToString) Else Msgbox "There is no annotation selected" End If

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SelectAnnotation(System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects a GdPicture/XMP annotation.
member.param: An Annotation object index. Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1, or -1 to deselect all annotations.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Makes selected the first available annotation

example.code: GdViewer1.SelectAnnotation(0)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SetAnnotationEditorMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Defines the "editor mode" for the GdPicture/XMP annotation support.
member.param: True to let the user to edit available GdPicture/XMP annotations, else False (all annotations locked).
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.IsAnnoationVisibleAt(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified point, in the control space, is contained within a specific annotation bounding box.
member.param: An Annotation object index. Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1.
Specifies the x-coordinate of the point, in the control space.
Specifies the y-coordinate of the point, in the control space.
member.returns: True is the point if contained within the annotation, False otherwise.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.CancelLastAnnotInteractiveAdd
member.summary: Asks to the control to ignore the latest request of interactive annotation creation.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SaveAnnotationsToPage
member.summary: Forces the viewer to save the annotations to the current page. This method is automatically called internally on page change.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.RotateAnnotations(System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotates all annotations (use the page coordinate system) by a specific angle. A call to the Redraw method is needed to refresh the screen.
member.param: The angle of rotation. Supported values are 90, 180 and 270.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.ReloadAnnotations
member.summary: Forces the viewer to reload the annotations of the current page. Use this method only if the displayed image has been edited by another object. A call to the Redraw method is needed to refresh the screen.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.AddCustomAnnotInteractive(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows the user to add a new custom annotation using the mouse.
member.param: A private identifier defining the model of the annotation to add. This identifier should be subsequently used in the OnCustomAnnotationPaint event to render the desired custom annotation appearance.

remarks.para: This method is not supported by the COM Interop edition.
This method is used in the "Annotations" Demo. Please check appendix "Finding Demo Applications" for more information.
Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToPDF(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the displayed document in PDF format with GdPicture/XMP annotation support. In case of multipage document saving, the SavingProgress callback can be raised.
member.param: The path of PDF to create.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToPDF(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the displayed document into a stream, in PDF format with GdPicture/XMP annotation support. In case of multipage document saving, the SavingProgress callback can be raised.
member.param: The stream to save the PDF.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToPDF(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the displayed document in PDF format with GdPicture/XMP annotation support on a distant server using HTTP or FTP transfer. In case of multipage document saving, the SavingProgress callback can be raised. The file transfer will be run synchronously.
member.param: The full uri of the file to create. IE: ftp://ftp.gdpicture.com/upload/myfile.pdf or http://www.gdpicture.com/upload/myfile.pdf.
The login required to be authenticated on the server. Can be an empty string.
The password required to be authenticated on the server. Can be an empty string.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If HTTP or FTP error status is returned the GetLastTransferError method can be used to diagnose the error.
member.remarks: This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToTIFF(System.String,GdPicture12.TiffCompression)
member.summary: Saves the displayed document in TIFF format with GdPicture/XMP annotation support. In case of multipage document saving, the SavingProgress callback can be raised.
member.param: The path of TIFF to create.
A member of the TiffCompression enumeration.
member.remarks: - Warning for multipage tiff documents: If the file destination is the same as the input document a GdPictureStatus.AccessDenied error will be returned. To avoid such problem you can turn the ForceTemporaryModeForImage property to True. This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.BurnAnnotationsToPage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Burns (or flatten) the GdPicture/XMP annotation of the current page of the displayed document. To burn custom annotations you need to use the overload taking a VectorMode parameter set to False.
member.param: True to remove annotation blob content from the file, else False.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.BurnAnnotationsToPage(System.Boolean,GdPicture12.GdPictureOutputIntent)
member.summary: Burns (or flatten) the GdPicture/XMP annotation of the current page of the displayed document. This overload doesn't support custom annotation burning.
member.param: True to remove annotation blob content from the file, else False.
A member of the GdPictureOutputIntent enumeration. Defines the intent of the produced page. Default value is IntentColor. Other intents produce smaller page size.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.BurnAnnotationsToPage(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Burns (or flatten) the GdPicture/XMP annotation of the current page of the displayed document.
member.param: True to remove annotation blob content from the file, else False.
Determines if annotations data must be renderd in vector format. This parameter is only suitable for PDF annotations burning. Custom annotations can be burned only when VectorMode is set to False.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayTextEditBox(System.Int32)
member.summary: Prompts the annotation text modification dialog box to the user. Can be used with StickyNote and Text annotations only. This method is particularly useful if you want to let the user subsequently define the text of the annotation after having added it (see example).
member.param: The index of the annotation.

code.description: Prompts the user to modify annotation text by intercepting the AnnotationAddedByUse event.

example.code: Private Sub GdViewer1_AnnotationAddedByUser(ByVal AnnotationIdx As Integer) Handles GdViewer1.AnnotationAddedByUser GdViewer1.DisplayTextEditBox(AnnotationIdx)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.HideTextEditBox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Hides the text modification dialog box from the control. Can be used with StickyNote and Text annotations only. If the annotation text modification dialog is not displayed, this method returns a GdPictureStatus.Aborted status.
member.param: Set true to apply the current text to the annotation, else False.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetVersion
member.summary: Returns the GdPicture source code version used in the following format M.mrr where 'M' describes the major version, 'm' the medium version and 'rr' the release number.

The red component. Valid values are 0 to 255.
The green component. Valid values are 0 to 255.
The blue component. Valid values are 0 to 255.

code.description: Getting ARGB Red color Using ARGBI.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetLastPath
member.summary: Returns the path of the latest loaded or saved file.

code.description: Prompt the user to select a document to display and retrieve the path of the selected file.

example.code: Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click GdViewer.DisplayFromFile("") 'Specifying empty string prompts the user to select a file Msgbox "File loaded: " + GdViewer.GetLastPath()

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayFromFTP(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored in a distant server using FTP access. The document will be loaded in an asynchronous way. You can catch the TransferProgress and the TransferEnded events to monitor the transfer.
member.param: The host server IE: ftp.gdicture.com.
The image file path into the distant server IE: /demo/image.jpg.
User Login.
User Password.
The FTP port number used. Usually 21.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If non OK the GetLastTransferError() method can be used to diagnose the error.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayFromFTP(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored in a distant server using FTP access. The document will be loaded in an asynchronous way. You can catch the TransferProgress and the TransferEnded events to monitor the transfer.
member.param: The path of the document. IE: ftp://ftp.mywebsite.com/mydocument.pdf.
User Login.
User Password.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If HTTP or FTP error status is returned the GetLastTransferError method can be used to diagnose the error.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SetHttpTransfertBufferSize(System.Int32)

member.param: True for passive FTP transfer mode, else Flase.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayFromHTTPStop
member.summary: Avoids the downloading started by the DisplayFromHTTP() or DisplayFromFTP() method.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayFromHTTP(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored in a distant server using HTTP. The document will be loaded in an asynchronous way. You can catch the TransferProgress and the TransferEnded events to monitor the transfer.
member.param: The host server. IE: http://www.gdpicture.com.
The image file path into the distant server. IE: /demo/image.jpg.
The HTTP port number used. Usually 80 or 443 to use https transfer mode.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If non OK the GetLastTransferError() method can be used to diagnose the error.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayFromHTTP(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored in a distant server using HTTP. The document will be loaded in an asynchronous way. You can catch the TransferProgress and the TransferEnded events to monitor the transfer.
member.param: The destination Uri. IE: http://guides.gdpicture.com/v8/pdf/GdPicture.NET8.pdf.
The login required to access the URI. Can be an empty string.
The password required to access the URI. Can be an empty string.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If HTTP or FTP error status is returned the GetLastTransferError method can be used to diagnose the error.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayFromByteArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored within an array of bytes.
member.param: The document data.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

code.description: Displaying an image on the GdViewer from a byte Array

example.code: Dim oFile As System.IO.FileInfo oFile = New System.IO.FileInfo("myimage.gif") Dim oFileStream As System.IO.FileStream = oFile.OpenRead() Dim lBytes As Integer = CInt(oFileStream.Length) If (lBytes > 0) Then Dim fileData(lBytes - 1) As Byte Dim ImageID As Integer oFileStream.Read(fileData, 0, lBytes) oFileStream.Close() oGdViewer.DisplayFromByteArray(fileData) End If

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayFromMemory(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)

member.param: A pointer to the area of the memory which stores the document.
The length in byte of the area.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.DisplayFromRawBits(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Displays an Image from raw bitmap in memory.
member.remarks: Warning: Do not remove the raw bitmap from the memory until you closed the displayed document.
member.param: Specifies the width, in pixels, of the bitmap.
Specifies the height, in pixels, of the bitmap.

Specifies the byte offset between the beginning of one scan line and the next. This is usually (but not necessarily) the number of bytes in the pixel format (for example, 2 for 16 bits per pixel) multiplied by the width of the bitmap. The value passed to this parameter must be a multiple of four.
Specifies the pixel format of the bitmap. A member of the PixelFormat enumeration.
Pointer to an array of bytes that contains the pixel data. The caller is responsible for allocating and freeing the block of memory pointed to by this parameter.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Using DisplayFromRawBits. The following code assumes that the bits of the image are stored in an IntPtr called iBits

example.code: oGdViewer.DisplayFromRawBits(250, 250, 750, Imaging.PixelFormat.Format24bppRgb, iBits)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetPageThumbnail(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates a High Quality thumbnail (returns a GdPicture image) of custom size from a page of the displayed document. This method fits the image thumbnail within a rectangle of specified dimensions having a specified background color. This GdPicture image can be used by another GdPictureImaging or GdViewer object.
member.param: The width of the thumbnail to create.
The height of the thumbnail to create.
The page of the document.
Color Object. Background color of the thumbnail.
member.returns: GdPicture Image Identifier. The Image thumbnail.Returns 0 if method failed.

remarks.para: To delete the created GdPicture image from the memory you must use the ReleaseGdPictureImage() method.
Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Creates a thumbnail of the current page and save it to PNG image.

example.code: Dim ImageID As Integer = GdViewer1.GetPageThumbnail(256, 256, GdViewer1.CurrentPage, GdViewer1.ARGB(255, 180, 180, 180)) Using oGdPictureImaging As New GdPictureImaging oGdPictureImaging.SaveAsPNG(ImageID, "thumbnail.png") End Using GdViewer1.ReleaseGdPictureImage(ImageID)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetPageThumbnail(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a High Quality thumbnail (returns a GdPicture image) of custom size from a page of the displayed document. This method fits the image thumbnail within a rectangle of specified dimensions having a specified background color. This GdPicture image can be used by another GdPictureImaging or GdViewer object.
member.param: The width of the thumbnail to create.
The height of the thumbnail to create.
The page of the document.
Background color of the thumbnail, as Integer value. A suitable color value can be obtained by using the ARGBI() method.
member.returns: GdPicture Image Identifier. The Image thumbnail.Returns 0 if method failed.

remarks.para: To delete the created GdPicture image from the memory you must use the ReleaseGdPictureImage() method.
Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Creates a thumbnail of the current page and save it to PNG image.

example.code: Dim ImageID As Integer = GdViewer1.GetPageThumbnail(256, 256, GdViewer1.CurrentPage, GdViewer1.ARGBI(255, 180, 180, 180)) Using oGdPictureImaging As New GdPictureImaging oGdPictureImaging.SaveAsPNG(ImageID, "thumbnail.png") End Using GdViewer1.ReleaseGdPictureImage(ImageID)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetPageThumbnailAsBitmap(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates a High Quality thumbnail (returns a Bitmap object) of custom size from a page of the displayed document. This method fits the image thumbnail within a rectangle of specified dimensions having a specified background color.
member.param: The width of the thumbnail to create.
The height of the thumbnail to create.
The page of the document.
Color Object. Background color of the thumbnail.
member.returns: The Image thumbnail.

code.description: Creates a thumbnail of the current page and save it to PNG image.

example.code: Using myBitmap As Bitmap = GdViewer1.GetPageThumbnailAsBitmap(256, 256, GdViewer1.CurrentPage, Color.Gray) myBitmap.Save("thumbnail.png") End Using

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.PdfSearchText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches the current page of the displayed PDF for a given text string.
member.param: The text to search for.

Optional. The occurrence of the text to search for. 0 to search and highlight all occurrences found else 1 to search for the first occurrence, 2 for the second... If you specify a value different of 0 the area covered by the occurrence found is made the current selection.
True to apply case-sensitive search, else False.
member.returns: True if the string has been found, else False.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Searches the current page for a string and highlight the result

example.code: Dim Text As String = InputBox("Search...") Dim Occurrence As Integer = 1 Dim Left, Top, Width, Height As Single Dim TextFound As Boolean = False GdViewer1.RemoveAllRegions() While GdViewer1.PdfSearchText(GdViewer1.CurrentPage, Text, Occurrence, False, Left, Top, Width, Height) TextFound = True GdViewer1.AddRegionInches("Region" & Str(Occurrence), Left, Top, Width, Height, ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMASKPEN, GdViewer1.ARGB(255, 255, 255, 0)) Occurrence = Occurrence + 1 End While If TextFound Then GdViewer1.Redraw() Else MessageBox.show("Not found !") End If

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.PdfSearchText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches the current page of the displayed PDF for a given text string.
member.param: The text to search for.

Optional. The occurrence of the text to search for. 0 to search and highlight all occurrences found else 1 to search for the first occurrence, 2 for the second... If you specify a value different of 0 the area covered by the occurrence found is made the current selection.
True to apply case-sensitive search, else False.
Searches for whole words only.
member.returns: True if the string has been found, else False.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Searches the current page for a string and highlight the result

example.code: Dim Text As String = InputBox("Search...") Dim Occurrence As Integer = 1 Dim Left, Top, Width, Height As Single Dim TextFound As Boolean = False GdViewer1.RemoveAllRegions() While GdViewer1.PdfSearchText(GdViewer1.CurrentPage, Text, Occurrence, False, Left, Top, Width, Height) TextFound = True GdViewer1.AddRegionInches("Region" & Str(Occurrence), Left, Top, Width, Height, ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMASKPEN, GdViewer1.ARGB(255, 255, 255, 0)) Occurrence = Occurrence + 1 End While If TextFound Then GdViewer1.Redraw() Else MessageBox.show("Not found !") End If

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.PdfSearchText(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Searches a specific page of the displayed PDF for an occurrence of a given text string and returns its bounding box.
member.param: The page to search.
The text to search for.
The occurrence of the text to search for. 1 to search for the first occurrence, 2 for the second... 0 is not accepted.
True to apply case-sensitive search, else False.
If the occurrence is found, returns the left position in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the top position in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the width in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the height in inches of the area covering the text.
member.returns: True if the string has been found, else False.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.summary: Searches a specific page of the displayed PDF for an occurrence of a given text string and returns its bounding box.
member.param: The page to search.
The text to search for.
The occurrence of the text to search for. 1 to search for the first occurrence, 2 for the second... 0 is not accepted.
True to apply case-sensitive search, else False.
Searches for whole words only.
If the occurrence is found, returns the left position in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the top position in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the width in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the height in inches of the area covering the text.
member.returns: True if the string has been found, else False.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.PdfGetPageWidth
member.summary: Returns the page width in PDF point unit of the selected page of the displayed PDF.
member.returns: The page width. Returns 0 if failed.

remarks.para: 1 point = 1/72 inch.
To get the page width in inches: Width = PdfGetPageWidth() / 72
To get the page width in centimeters: Width = PdfGetPageWidth() / 72 * 2.54
Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.summary: Returns the page height in PDF point unit of the selected page of the displayed PDF.
member.returns: The page width. Returns 0 if failed.

remarks.para: 1 point = 1/72 inch.
To get the page height in inches: Height = PdfGetPageHeight() / 72
To get the page height in centimeters: Height = PdfGetPageHeight() / 72 * 2.54
Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetMouseLeftInDocument
member.summary: Returns the left coordinate, in pixel, (0 based) of the mouse position over the page of the displayed document.
member.remarks: To get the position in inches, just divide the returned result by HorizontalResolution. IE: double posX = object.GetMouseLeftInDocument() / object.HorizontalResolution;.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.GetMouseTopInDocument
member.summary: Returns the top coordinate, in pixel, (0 based) of the mouse position over the page of the displayed document.
member.remarks: To get the position in inches, just divide the returned result by VerticalResolution. IE: double posY = object.GetMouseTopInDocument() / object.VerticalResolution;.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.GdViewer.SetItemMenuCaption(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the caption of an item of the contextual menu.
member.param:
Item Index. Can be:
1: Pages / Frames
2: Pages / Frames -> Goto First
3: Pages / Frames -> Goto Previous
4: Pages / Frames -> Goto Next
5: Pages / Frames -> Goto Last
6: Play Gif
7: Stop Gif Animation
8: Rotations - Flips
9: Rotations - Flips -> Rotate 90
10: Rotations - Flips -> Rotate 180
11: Rotations - Flips -> Rotate 270
12: Rotations - Flips -> Flip X
13: Rotations - Flips -> RotateFlip 90
14: Rotations - Flips -> RotateFlip 180
15: Rotations - Flips -> RotateFlip 270
16: ScrollBars
17: Copy Bitmap to Clipboard
18: Zoom
19: Zoom -> Zoom in
20: Zoom -> Zoom out
21: Zoom -> Zoom 100%
22: Zoom -> Zoom to selected area
23: Zoom -> Fit image to viewer (keep aspect ratio)
24: Zoom -> Fit image to viewer (don't keep aspect ratio)
25: Zoom -> Fit image to viewer width
26: Zoom -> Fit image to viewer height
27: Mouse Mode
28: Mouse Mode -> Nothing
29: Mouse Mode -> Hand Pan Tool
30: Mouse Mode -> Area Selection Tool
31: Left Click -> Area Zooming Tool
32: Viewer Quality
33: Viewer Quality -> Automatic
34: Viewer Quality -> Quality Low
35: Viewer Quality -> Quality Bilinear
36: Viewer Quality -> Quality Bicubic
37: Viewer Quality -> Quality Bilinear HQ
38: Viewer Quality -> Quality Bicubic HQ
39: Mouse Mode -> Magnifier Tool
40: Copy Text to Clipboard

member.name: P:GdPicture12.GdViewer.PdfShowOpenFileDialogForDecryption
member.summary: If the PDF to open is protected by certificate, the control will prompt the user for certificate selection from a file. Turn this property to False to use your own dialog box (you will have to catch the PdfCertificateRequest event). Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.GdViewer.PdfEnableFileLinks
member.summary: PDF documents are often designed to contain links to other PDF. Such option is usually provided through a GoToR action handled by special objects such as bookmarks and form field links. This property turned to True allows the viewer to automatically navigates to the linked document, if any. Such action can be performed when the user clicks a node of a linked BookmarkTree object or a form field on the Viewer. The PdfFileNavigation event is fired before displaying the new document. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.GdViewer.PdfIncreaseTextContrast
member.summary: Specifies if the rendering engine should increase text contrast on low zoom in order to enhance readability. This feature can decrease rendering speed performances on old machines. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.GdViewer.PdfVerifyDigitalCertificates
member.summary: Specifies if the viewer is responsible to check digital certificate when rendering a PDF document containing a digital signature. Depending on the outcome of the certificate audit, the visible appearances associated to each digital signature could be adjusted. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.GdViewer.Gamma
member.summary: Defines the gamma value, which represents the brightness of the displayed document. Gamma values range from 0.1 to 5.0 (normally 0.1 to 2.2), where a value less than 1 lightens the image, a value of 1 leaves the image unaffected and an value greater than 1 darkens the image. Default value is 1.

member.name: E:GdPicture12.GdViewer.OnCustomAnnotationPaint
member.summary: Occurs when a custom annotation must be rendered.
member.param: The custom annotation object to render.
The graphics object to render the custom annotation appearance.

remarks.para: This event is not supported by the COM Interop edition.
This event is used in the "Annotations" Demo. Please check appendix "Finding Demo Applications" for more information.
The measurement unit, for dimensions and sizes, is expressed in inches.
The rotation, if any, is handled by the component which automatically set to required transformation.

You have to render the annotation's appearance in the bounding box defined by [x, y, w, h], where x and y define the coordinates of the top-left corner of the box equal to (Annot.Left - Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2), w defines the width equal to Annot.Width and y the height equal to Annot.Height.

code.description: Rendering custom annotations.

example.code: Private Sub GdViewer1_OnCustomAnnotationPaint(ByVal Annot As GdPicture12.AnnotationCustom, ByVal g As System.Drawing.Graphics) Handles GdViewer1.OnCustomAnnotationPaint Select Case Annot.ModelID Case 1 'triangle annotation, previously defined by the AddCustomAnnotInteractive() method. Using gp As New Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath gp.AddLine(New PointF(Annot.Left - Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top + Annot.Height / 2), New PointF(Annot.Left, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2)) gp.AddLine(New PointF(Annot.Left, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2), New PointF(Annot.Left + Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top + Annot.Height / 2)) gp.CloseFigure() g.DrawPath(New Pen(Brushes.Red, 0.1), gp) End Using Case 2 'cross annotation, previously defined by the AddCustomAnnotInteractive() method. g.DrawLine(New Pen(Brushes.Red, 0.1), New PointF(Annot.Left - Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2), New PointF(Annot.Left + Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top + Annot.Height / 2)) g.DrawLine(New Pen(Brushes.Red, 0.1), New PointF(Annot.Left - Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top + Annot.Height / 2), New PointF(Annot.Left + Annot.Width / 2, Annot.Top - Annot.Height / 2)) End Select End Sub

member.name: E:GdPicture12.GdViewer.BeforeAnnotationAddedByUser
member.summary: Occurs when a GdPicture/XMP annotation has been added by the user. This event occurs in mouse down action, therefore it can be particularly useful to change some properties of the new annotation to add before rendering it to the screen. See example.
member.param: The index of the annotation.

code.description: Catch the BeforeAnnotationAddedByUser event to modify the background color of the new added sticky-note annotations.

example.code: Private Sub GdViewer1_AnnotationAddedByUser(ByVal AnnotationIdx As Integer) Handles GdViewer1.BeforeAnnotationAddedByUser Dim annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(AnnotationIdx) If TypeOf annot Is AnnotationStickyNote Then DirectCast(annot, AnnotationStickyNote).FillColor = Color.Beige GdViewer1.DisplayTextEditBox(AnnotationIdx) End If

member.name: E:GdPicture12.GdViewer.ClickMenu
member.summary: Occurs when an item of the contextual menu has been clicked.
member.param:
Item Index. Can be:
1: Pages / Frames
2: Pages / Frames -> Goto First
3: Pages / Frames -> Goto Previous
4: Pages / Frames -> Goto Next
5: Pages / Frames -> Goto Last
6: Play Gif
7: Stop Gif Animation
8: Rotations - Flips
9: Rotations - Flips -> Rotate 90
10: Rotations - Flips -> Rotate 180
11: Rotations - Flips -> Rotate 270
12: Rotations - Flips -> Flip X
13: Rotations - Flips -> RotateFlip 90
14: Rotations - Flips -> RotateFlip 180
15: Rotations - Flips -> RotateFlip 270
16: ScrollBars
17: Copy Bitmap to Clipboard
18: Zoom
19: Zoom -> Zoom in
20: Zoom -> Zoom out
21: Zoom -> Zoom 100%
22: Zoom -> Zoom to selected area
23: Zoom -> Fit image to viewer (keep aspect ratio)
24: Zoom -> Fit image to viewer (don't keep aspect ratio)
25: Zoom -> Fit image to viewer width
26: Zoom -> Fit image to viewer height
27: Mouse Mode
28: Mouse Mode -> Nothing
29: Mouse Mode -> Hand Pan Tool
30: Mouse Mode -> Area Selection Tool
31: Left Click -> Area Zooming Tool
32: Viewer Quality
33: Viewer Quality -> Automatic
34: Viewer Quality -> Quality Low
35: Viewer Quality -> Quality Bilinear
36: Viewer Quality -> Quality Bicubic
37: Viewer Quality -> Quality Bilinear HQ
38: Viewer Quality -> Quality Bicubic HQ
39: Mouse Mode -> Magnifier Tool
40: Copy Text to Clipboard

member.name: M:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Load thumbnails from directory. The ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each image or PDF document found in the directory. Thumbnails will be generated asynchronously.
member.param: The path from which thumbnail will be generated.
Set to True to include sub folders else False.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Load thumbnails from directory. The ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each image or PDF document found in the directory. Thumbnails will be generated asynchronously.
member.param: The path from which thumbnails will be generated.
Set to True to include sub folders else False.

The search string to match against the names of files in path. IE: "*.tif" The parameter cannot end in two periods ("..") or contain two periods ("..") followed by DirectorySeparatorChar or AltDirectorySeparatorChar, nor can it contain any of the characters in InvalidPathChars. Wildcard character: - * Zero or more characters. - ? Exactly one character.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Load thumbnails from directory. The ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each image or PDF document found in the directory. Thumbnails will be generated asynchronously.
member.param: The path from which thumbnails will be generated.
Set to True to include sub folders else False.

An array of search strings to match against the names of files in path. IE: "*.tif" The parameter cannot end in two periods ("..") or contain two periods ("..") followed by DirectorySeparatorChar or AltDirectorySeparatorChar, nor can it contain any of the characters in InvalidPathChars. Wildcard character: - * Zero or more characters. - ? Exactly one character.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.summary: Defines the rasterizer engine to use for PDF rendering purposes. Default value is PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineHybrid.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.PdfIncreaseTextContrast
member.summary: Specifies if the rendering engine should increase text contrast on low zoom in order to enhance readability. This feature can decrease rendering speed performances on old machines. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.RotateExif
member.summary: Specifies if each item must be rotated according to Exif Orientation tag, if any. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.OwnDrop
member.summary: Turn this property to True to implement your own drag and drop support. Default value is False.
member.remarks: Turning this property to True automatically switch AllowDropFiles and AllowMoveItems properties to false.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.PauseThumbsLoading
member.summary: Turn this property to True to pause the background process generating thumbnails. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.DisplayAnnotations
member.summary: Specifies if annotations are displayed in each thumbnail. True by default. Annotations can be GdPicture/XMP annotations, PDF annotations and PDF FormFields. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.PreloadAllItems
member.summary: Specifies if all items must be generated in background. If False, only visible items will be generated. False is recommended if the number of items exceed 1000. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.AllItemsLoaded
member.summary: Returns true if all items have been loaded, else false.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailBackColor_Internal
member.summary: Defines the background color of all thumbnails.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailForeColor_Internal
member.summary: Defines the fore color of all thumbnails.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailBackColor
member.summary: Specifies the default background color of thumbnails. Default color is Gray.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailForeColor
member.summary: Specifies the default foreground color of thumbnails. Default color is Black.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.SelectedThumbnailBackColor
member.summary: Defines the highlighting color of selected thumbnails.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailSize
member.summary: The size, in pixel, of each thumbnail. Default value is (128, 128).
member.remarks: For COM version: this property might not be reachable within some environments, in this case use the SetItemsSize method instead.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailSpacing
member.summary: Sets the spacing between each thumbnail in the control. Set a size of (0, 0) to apply automatic spacing, otherwise a size larger than ThumbnailSize is suggested. Default value is (0, 0).
member.remarks: For COM version: this property might not be reachable within some environments, in this case use the SetItemsSpacing method instead. Values for are relative to the upper-left corner of an icon bitmap. Therefore, to set spacing between items that do not overlap, the values must include the size of the icon, plus the amount of empty space desired between icons. Values that do not include the width of the icon will result in overlaps.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.HorizontalTextAlignment
member.summary: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text of each thumbnail. Default value is StringAlignment.Center.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.VerticalTextAlignment
member.summary: Defines the vertical alignment of the text of each thumbnail. Default value is StringAlignment.Center.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailBorder
member.summary: Specifies if thumbnails have border appearance. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailAlignment
member.summary: Defines alignment of thumbnails in the control. Default value is ThumbnailAlignment.ThumbnailAlignmentVertical.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ShowText
member.summary: Specifies if a text is displayed near each thumbnail. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.ItemCount
member.summary: The number of items in the control. Read only.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.CheckBoxes
member.summary: Specifies if a check box appears next each item in the ThumbnailEx control. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.CheckBoxesMarginLeft
member.summary: Defines custom checkboxes left margin. Negative margin is allowed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.CheckBoxesMarginTop
member.summary: Defines custom checkboxes top margin. Negative margin is allowed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.TextMarginLeft
member.summary: Defines custom text left margin. Negative margin is allowed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.TextMarginTop
member.summary: Defines custom text top margin. Negative margin is allowed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.MultiSelect
member.summary: Specifies if multiple items can be selected. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.AllowMoveItems
member.summary: Specifies if the user is able to mode items by dragging operation. The event ItemMoved is raised for each item moving. Default value is False.
member.remarks: Turning this property to True automatically switch OwnDrop property to false.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.AllowDropFiles
member.summary: Specifies if the user is able to drop files from the explorer to the control. User will be allowed to drop files only if the items of the control has been loaded using LoadFromDirectory or if the control is empty. Default value is False.
member.remarks: Turning this property to True automatically switch OwnDrop property to false.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.LockGdViewerEvents
member.summary: Specifies if the ThumbnailEx control is reactive to the GdViewer events. This property is available only when thumbnails source is a GdViewer object passed to the LoadFromGdViewer method. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.HotTracking
member.summary: Specifies if an item has appearance of a hyperlink when the mouse pointer passes over it. Default value is False.

member.name: E:GdPicture12.ThumbnailEx.FileTypeNotSupported
member.summary: Occurs when a file type is not supported by the control. It is possible to provide a specific Bitmap to be used in the item through the CustomBitmap property.
member.param: The path of the unsupported file.
A GdPicture Image Identifier which can be passed by reference.
A reference to a boolean value. If set to true and if a CustomBitmapID parameter is provided, the control will automatically release the CustomBitmapID from the memory.

code.description: Implementing a custom bitmap for unknown file type.

example.code: Private Sub ThumbnailEx1_FileTypeNotSupported(ByVal FilePath As String, ByRef CustomBitmapID As Integer, ByRef ReleaseBitmap As Boolean) Handles ThumbnailEx1.FileTypeNotSupported ReleaseBitmap = True Using gdPictureImaging As New GdPictureImaging CustomBitmapID = gdPictureImaging.CreateGdPictureImageFromFile("unsupported.png") End Using End Sub

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromGdPicturePDF(GdPicture12.GdPicturePDF)
member.summary: Load thumbnails from PDF document loaded by a GdPictureImaging object. The ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each page in the document. Thumbnails will be created asynchronously.
member.param: A GdPicturePDF object.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromGdViewer(GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer)
member.summary: Load thumbnails from a GdViewer object. If the GdViewer object handles a multipage document, the ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each page. Thumbnails will be created asynchronously.
member.param: A GdViewer object.
member.remarks: When the user selects an item in the thumbnail list, the GdViewer will automatically displays the corresponding page. And vice versa.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromGdPictureImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Load thumbnails from a GdPicture Image. If the GdPicture image is a multipage image, the ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each page. Thumbnails will be created asynchronously.
member.param: A GdPicture Image identifier.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Load thumbnails from directory. The ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each image or PDF document found in the directory. Thumbnails will be generated asynchronously.
member.param: The path from which thumbnail will be generated.
Set to True to include sub folders else False.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Load thumbnails from directory. The ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each image or PDF document found in the directory. Thumbnails will be generated asynchronously.
member.param: The path from which thumbnails will be generated.
Set to True to include sub folders else False.

The search string to match against the names of files in path. IE: "*.tif" The parameter cannot end in two periods ("..") or contain two periods ("..") followed by DirectorySeparatorChar or AltDirectorySeparatorChar, nor can it contain any of the characters in InvalidPathChars. Wildcard character: - * Zero or more characters. - ? Exactly one character.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Load thumbnails from directory. The ThumbnailEx control will generate a thumbnail for each image or PDF document found in the directory. Thumbnails will be generated asynchronously.
member.param: The path from which thumbnails will be generated.
Set to True to include sub folders else False.

An array of search strings to match against the names of files in path. IE: "*.tif" The parameter cannot end in two periods ("..") or contain two periods ("..") followed by DirectorySeparatorChar or AltDirectorySeparatorChar, nor can it contain any of the characters in InvalidPathChars. Wildcard character: - * Zero or more characters. - ? Exactly one character.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.LoadFromFiles(System.String[])
member.summary: Load thumbnails from an array of files. Thumbnails will be generated asynchronously.
member.param: An array of file path from which thumbnails will be generated.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailEffect
member.summary: Get or set the bitmap effect to apply to the items. This property is avaible only with Framework 4.0 and higher.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.PdfIncreaseTextContrast
member.summary: Specifies if the rendering engine should increase text contrast on low zoom in order to enhance readability. This feature can decrease rendering speed performances on old machines. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.IsDeferredScrollingEnabled
member.summary: Whether deferred scrolling is enabled. If set to true, visual state will not be updated until the scrollbar mouse capture is released. Default value is false.
member.remarks: Displaying a large number of items may cause performance issues. In this case, it might be useful to use deferred scrolling.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.PdfRasterizerEngine
member.summary: Defines the rasterizer engine to use for PDF rendering purposes. Default value is PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineHybrid.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.RotateExif
member.summary: Specifies if each item must be rotated according to Exif Orientation tag, if any. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailAlignment
member.summary: Defines alignment of thumbnails in the control. Default value is ThumbnailAlignment.ThumbnailAlignmentVertical.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.PauseThumbsLoading
member.summary: Turn this property to True to pause the background process generating thumbnails. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.DisplayAnnotations
member.summary: Specifies if annotations are displayed in each thumbnail. True by default. Annotations can be GdPicture/XMP annotations, PDF annotations and PDF FormFields. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.PreloadAllItems
member.summary: Specifies if all items must be generated in the background. If False, only visible items will be generated. False is recommended if the number of items exceeds 1000. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.AllItemsLoaded
member.summary: Returns true if all items have been loaded, else false.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailBackColor
member.summary: Defines the background color of all thumbnails. Default value is Transparent.
member.remarks: The SetItemBackgroundColor() should be used to set the background color of a specific thumbnail.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailSize
member.summary: The size, in pixels, of each thumbnail. Default value is (128, 128).

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.TextSpaceHeight
member.summary: Space for the height of the text bellow the thumbnail item image. If text height is bigger than this value, the text will be clipped to this. Default is 16.0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.ThumbnailSpacing
member.summary: Sets the spacing between each thumbnail in the control. Default value is (25, 25).

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.HorizontalTextAlignment
member.summary: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text of each thumbnail. Default value is StringAlignment.Center.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.ShowText
member.summary: Specifies if a text is displayed near each thumbnail. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.ItemCount
member.summary: The number of items in the control. Read only.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.CheckBoxes
member.summary: Specifies if a checkbox appears next to each item in the ThumbnailEx control. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.CheckBoxesMarginLeft
member.summary: Defines checkboxes left margin. Negative margin is allowed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.CheckBoxesMarginTop
member.summary: Defines checkboxes top margin. Negative margin is allowed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.TextMarginLeft
member.summary: Defines custom text left margin. Negative margin is allowed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.TextMarginTop
member.summary: Defines custom text top margin. Negative margin is allowed. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.MultiSelect
member.summary: Specifies if multiple items can be selected. If set to True, multiple items are selected one by one. Pressing shift would select all items in between last item clicked and nearest previously selected item. MultiSelect is equivelant of the WPF Extended SelectionMode. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.AllowMoveItems
member.summary: Specifies if the user is able to move items by a dragging operation. The event ItemMoved is raised for each item moving. If MultiSelect is set to True, pressing shift on the last selected item is required for multi-item move. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.AllowDropFiles
member.summary: Specifies if the user is able to drop files from the explorer to the control. User will be allowed to drop files only if the items of the control has been loaded using LoadFromDirectory or if the control is empty. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.LockGdViewerEvents
member.summary: Specifies if the ThumbnailEx control is reactive to the GdViewer events. This property is available only when thumbnails source is a GdViewer object passed to the LoadFromGdViewer method. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.ItemContainerStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the System.Windows.Style that is applied to the container element generated for each thumbnail item. Default value is Null.
member.returns: The System.Windows.Style that is applied to the container element generated for each thumbnail item.

member.name: E:GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.FileTypeNotSupported
member.summary: Occurs when a file type is not supported by the control. It is possible to provide a specific Bitmap to be used in the item through the CustomBitmap property.

code.description: Implementing a custom bitmap for unknown file type.

example.code: Private Sub ThumbnailEx1_FileTypeNotSupported( ByVal sender As object , ByVal e As GdPicture12.WPF.ThumbnailEx.FileTypeNotSupportedEventArgs) Handles ThumbnailEx1.FileTypeNotSupported e.ReleaseBitmap = True Using gdPictureImaging As New GdPictureImaging e.CustomBitmapID = gdPictureImaging.CreateGdPictureImageFromFile("unsupported.png") End Using End Sub

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.ClickMenuEventArgs.MenuItem
member.summary:
Item Index. Can be:
2: Pages / Frames || Goto First
3: Pages / Frames || Goto Previous
4: Pages / Frames || Goto Next
5: Pages / Frames || Goto Last
100: Play Gif
200: Stop Gif Animation
310: Rotation || Rotate Page 90
311: Rotation || Rotate Page 180
312: Rotation || Rotate Page 270
313: Rotation || Flip Page Horizontally
314: Rotation || Flip Page Vertically
315: Rotation || Rotate View 90
316: Rotation || Rotate View 180
317: Rotation || Rotate View 270
318: Rotation || Flip View Horizontally
319: Rotation || Flip View Vertically
400: ScrollBars
500: Copy Bitmap to Clipboard
501: Copy Text to Clipboard
601: Zoom || Zoom in
602: Zoom || Zoom out
603: Zoom || Zoom 100%
604: Zoom || Zoom to selected area
605: Zoom || Fit image to viewer (keep aspect ratio)
606: Zoom || Fit image to viewer width
607: Zoom || Fit image to viewer height
701: Mouse Mode || Nothing
702: Mouse Mode || Hand Pan Tool
703: Mouse Mode || Area Selection Tool
704: Mouse Mode || Area Zooming Tool
705: Mouse Mode || Magnifier Tool
801: ViewerQuality || Low
802: ViewerQuality || Medium
803: ViewerQuality || High

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetAnnotationCount
member.summary: Returns the number of GdPicture/XMP annotations available on the current page of the displayed document.
member.returns: The number of available annotations.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Displays creation data and author of all available annotations

example.code: For i As Integer = 0 To GdViewer1.GetAnnotationCount() - 1 Dim Annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(i) MessageBox.show("Author: " + Annot.Author) MessageBox.show("Creation time: " + Annot.CreationTime.ToString) Next

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetAnnotationFromIdx(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a GdPicture/XMP annotations available on the current page of the displayed document.
member.returns: An Annotation object.
member.param: The index of the annotation (0-based). Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Displays creation data and author of all available annotations

example.code: For i As Integer = 0 To GdViewer1.GetAnnotationCount() - 1 Dim Annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(i) MessageBox.show("Author: " + Annot.Author) MessageBox.show("Creation time: " + Annot.CreationTime.ToString) Next

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DeleteAnnotation(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a GdPicture/XMP annotation on the current page of the displayed document.
member.param: The index of the annotation (0-based). Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Remove all available annotations

example.code: For i As Integer = 1 To GdViewer1.GetAnnotationCount() GdViewer1.DeleteAnnotation(0) Next

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetSelectedAnnotationIdx
member.summary: Returns the index of the selected GdPicture/XMP annotation.
member.returns: An Annotation object index. Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1 if an annotation is selected, else -1.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Displays creation data and author of the selected annotation

example.code: Dim AnnotationIdx as integer = GdViewer1.GetSelectedAnnotationIdx() If AnnotationIdx >= 0 Then Dim Annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(AnnotationIdx) MessageBox.show("Author: " + Annot.Author) MessageBox.show("Creation time: " + Annot.CreationTime.ToString) Else Msgbox "There is no annotation selected" End If

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SelectAnnotation(System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects a GdPicture/XMP annotation.
member.param: An Annotation object index. Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1, or -1 to deselect all annotations.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Makes selected the first available annotation

example.code: GdViewer1.SelectAnnotation(0)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SetAnnotationEditorMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Defines the "editor mode" for the GdPicture/XMP annotation support.
member.param: True to let the user to edit available GdPicture/XMP annotations, else False (all annotations locked).
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.IsAnnoationVisibleAt(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified point, in the control space, is contained within a specific annotation bounding box.
member.param: An Annotation object index. Must be a value between 0 and GetAnnotationCount() - 1.
Specifies the x-coordinate of the point, in the control space.
Specifies the y-coordinate of the point, in the control space.
member.returns: True is the point if contained within the annotation, False otherwise.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SaveAnnotationsToPage
member.summary: Forces the viewer to save the annotations to the current page. This method is automatically called internally on page change.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.RotateAnnotations(System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotates all annotations (use the page coordinate system) by a specific angle. A call to the Redraw method is needed to refresh the screen.
member.param: The angle of rotation. Supported values are 90, 180 and 270.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.ReloadAnnotations
member.summary: Forces the viewer to reload the annotations of the current page. Use this method only if the displayed image has been edited by another object. A call to the Redraw method is needed to refresh the screen.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetAnnotationManager
member.summary: Gets the AnnotationManager object associated with the Viewer.
member.returns: An AnnotationManager object. It is important to do not dispose this object.
