member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToPDF(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the displayed document in PDF format with GdPicture/XMP annotation support. In case of multipage document saving, the SavingProgress callback can be raised.
member.param: The path of PDF to create.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToPDF(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the displayed document into a stream, in PDF format with GdPicture/XMP annotation support. In case of multipage document saving, the SavingProgress callback can be raised.
member.param: The stream to save the PDF.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToPDF(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the displayed document in PDF format with GdPicture/XMP annotation support on a distant server using HTTP or FTP transfer. In case of multipage document saving, the SavingProgress callback can be raised. The file transfer will be run synchronously.
member.param: The full uri of the file to create. IE: ftp://ftp.gdpicture.com/upload/myfile.pdf or http://www.gdpicture.com/upload/myfile.pdf.
The login required to be authenticated on the server. Can be an empty string.
The password required to be authenticated on the server. Can be an empty string.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If HTTP or FTP error status is returned the GetLastTransferError method can be used to diagnose the error.
member.remarks: This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToTIFF(System.String,GdPicture12.TiffCompression)
member.summary: Saves the displayed document in TIFF format with GdPicture/XMP annotation support. In case of multipage document saving, the SavingProgress callback can be raised.
member.param: The path of TIFF to create.
A member of the TiffCompression enumeration.
member.remarks: - Warning for multipage tiff documents: If the file destination is the same as the input document a GdPictureStatus.AccessDenied error will be returned. To avoid such problem you can turn the ForceTemporaryModeForImage property to True. This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SaveDocumentToTIFF(System.IO.Stream,GdPicture12.TiffCompression)

member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: This method has been implemented to save document with GdPicture/XMP annotations. Therefore, the GdPicture/XMP annotation Plugin is required to use it.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.BurnAnnotationsToPage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Burns (or flatten) the GdPicture/XMP annotation of the current page of the displayed document. To burn custom annotations you need to use the overload taking a VectorMode parameter set to False.
member.param: True to remove annotation blob content from the file, else False.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.BurnAnnotationsToPage(System.Boolean,GdPicture12.GdPictureOutputIntent)
member.summary: Burns (or flatten) the GdPicture/XMP annotation of the current page of the displayed document. This overload doesn't support custom annotation burning.
member.param: True to remove annotation blob content from the file, else False.
A member of the GdPictureOutputIntent enumeration. Defines the intent of the produced page. Default value is IntentColor. Other intents produce smaller page size.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.BurnAnnotationsToPage(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Burns (or flatten) the GdPicture/XMP annotation of the current page of the displayed document.
member.param: True to remove annotation blob content from the file, else False.
Determines if annotations data must be renderd in vector format. This parameter is only suitable for PDF annotations burning. Custom annotations can be burned only when VectorMode is set to False.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayTextEditBox(System.Int32)
member.summary: Prompts the annotation text modification dialog box to the user. Can be used with StickyNote and Text annotations only. This method is particularly useful if you want to let the user subsequently define the text of the annotation after having added it (see example).
member.param: The index of the annotation.

code.description: Prompts the user to modify annotation text by intercepting the AnnotationAddedByUse event.

example.code: Private Sub GdViewer1_AnnotationAddedByUser(ByVal AnnotationIdx As Integer) Handles GdViewer1.AnnotationAddedByUser GdViewer1.DisplayTextEditBox(AnnotationIdx)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.HideTextEditBox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Hides the text modification dialog box from the control. Can be used with StickyNote and Text annotations only. If the annotation text modification dialog is not displayed, this method returns a GdPictureStatus.Aborted status.
member.param: Set true to apply the current text to the annotation, else False.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetLastPath
member.summary: Returns the path of the latest loaded file.
member.returns: The latest loaded or saved file path.

code.description: Prompt the user to select a document to display and retrieve the path of the selected file.

example.code: Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click GdViewer.DisplayFromFile("") 'Specifying empty string prompts the user to select a file Msgbox "File loaded: " + GdViewer.GetLastPath()

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetLastTransferError
member.summary: Returns, if any, the last HTTP or FTP transfer error description.
member.returns: The error description.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetVersion
member.summary: Returns the GdPicture source code version used in the following format M.mrr where 'M' describes the major version, 'm' the medium version and 'rr' the release number.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetStat

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file.
member.param: The path of the document to display. Can be an empty string. If empty, prompts the user to select a file. You can subsequently use the GetLastPath() method to retrieve the path of the selected file.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayFromFTP(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored in a distant server using FTP access. The document will be loaded in an asynchronous way. You can catch the TransferProgress and the TransferEnded events to monitor the transfer.
member.param: The host server IE: ftp.gdicture.com.
The image file path into the distant server IE: /demo/image.jpg.
User Login.
User Password.
The FTP port number used. Usually 21.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If non OK the GetLastTransferError() method can be used for diagnosing the error.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayFromFTP(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored in a distant server using FTP access. The document will be loaded in an asynchronous way. You can catch the TransferProgress and the TransferEnded events to monitor the transfer.
member.param: The path of the document. IE: ftp://ftp.mywebsite.com/mydocument.pdf.
User Login.
User Password.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If HTTP or FTP error status is returned the GetLastTransferError method can be used for diagnosing the error.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SetHttpTransfertBufferSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the default packet size used by the DisplayFromHTTP() and DisplayFromFTP methods. Default value used is 4096.
member.param: New buffer size. ex 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192 etc.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.SetFtpPassiveMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies if the FTP transfer mode is Passive or not for the DisplayFromFTP() method. True by default.
member.param: True for passive FTP transfer mode, else Flase.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayFromHTTPStop
member.summary: Avoids the downloading started by the DisplayFromHTTP() or DisplayFromFTP() method.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayFromHTTP(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored in a distant server using HTTP. The document will be loaded in an asynchronous way. You can catch the TransferProgress and the TransferEnded events to monitor the transfer.
member.param: The host server. IE: http://www.gdpicture.com.
The image file path into the distant server. IE: /demo/image.jpg.
The HTTP port number used. Usually 80 or 443 to use https transfer mode.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If non OK the GetLastTransferError() method can be used for diagnosing the error.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayFromHTTP(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored in a distant server using HTTP. The document will be loaded in an asynchronous way. You can catch the TransferProgress and the TransferEnded events to monitor the transfer.
member.param: The destination Uri. IE: http://guides.gdpicture.com/v8/pdf/GdPicture.NET8.pdf.
The login required to access the URI. Can be an empty string.
The password required to access the URI. Can be an empty string.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration. If HTTP or FTP error status is returned the GetLastTransferError method can be used for diagnosing the error.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayFromByteArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Displays a document from a file stored within an array of bytes.
member.param: The document data.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.
member.remarks: Supported formats are listed here: http://www.gdpicture.com/solutions/supported-formats/.

code.description: Displaying an image on the GdViewer from a byte Array

example.code: Dim oFile As System.IO.FileInfo oFile = New System.IO.FileInfo("myimage.gif") Dim oFileStream As System.IO.FileStream = oFile.OpenRead() Dim lBytes As Integer = CInt(oFileStream.Length) If (lBytes > 0) Then Dim fileData(lBytes - 1) As Byte Dim ImageID As Integer oFileStream.Read(fileData, 0, lBytes) oFileStream.Close() oGdViewer.DisplayFromByteArray(fileData) End If

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DisplayFromRawBits(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Imaging.PixelFormat,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Displays an Image from raw bitmap in memory.
member.remarks: Warning: Do not remove the raw bitmap from the memory until you closed the displayed document.
member.param: Specifies the width, in pixels, of the bitmap.
Specifies the height, in pixels, of the bitmap.

Specifies the byte offset between the beginning of one scan line and the next. This is usually (but not necessarily) the number of bytes in the pixel format (for example, 2 for 16 bits per pixel) multiplied by the width of the bitmap. The value passed to this parameter must be a multiple of four.
Specifies the pixel format of the bitmap. A member of the PixelFormat enumeration.
Pointer to an array of bytes that contains the pixel data. The caller is responsible for allocating and freeing the block of memory pointed to by this parameter.
member.returns: A member of the GdPictureStatus enumeration.

code.description: Using DisplayFromRawBits. The following code assumes that the bits of the image are stored in an IntPtr called iBits

example.code: oGdViewer.DisplayFromRawBits(250, 250, 750, Imaging.PixelFormat.Format24bppRgb, iBits)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.GetPageThumbnail(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Creates a High Quality thumbnail (returns a GdPicture image) of custom size from a page of the displayed document. This method fits the image thumbnail within a rectangle of specified dimensions having a specified background color. This GdPicture image can be used by another GdPictureImaging or GdViewer object.
member.param: The width of the thumbnail to create.
The height of the thumbnail to create.
The page of the document.
Color Object. Background color of the thumbnail.
member.returns: GdPicture Image Identifier. The Image thumbnail.Returns 0 if method failed.

remarks.para: To delete the created GdPicture image from the memory you must use the ReleaseGdPictureImage() method.
Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Creates a thumbnail of the current page and save it to PNG image.

example.code: Dim ImageID As Integer = GdViewer1.GetPageThumbnail(256, 256, GdViewer1.CurrentPage, System.Windows.Media.Color.FromArgb(255, 180, 180, 180)) Using oGdPictureImaging As New GdPictureImaging oGdPictureImaging.SaveAsPNG(ImageID, "thumbnail.png") End Using GdViewer1.ReleaseGdPictureImage(ImageID)

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfSearchText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches the current page of the displayed PDF for a given text string.
member.param: The text to search for.

Optional. The occurrence of the text to search for. 0 to search and highlight all occurrences found else 1 to search for the first occurrence, 2 for the second... If you specify a value different of 0 the area covered by the occurrence found is made the current selection.
True to apply case-sensitive search, else False.
member.returns: True if the string has been found, else False.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Searches the current page for a string and highlight the result

example.code: Dim Text As String = "PDF" Dim Occurrence As Integer = 1 Dim Left As Double = 0 Dim Top As Double = 0 Dim Width As Double = 0 Dim Height As Double = 0 GdViewer1.RemoveAllRegions 'remove previously added regions, if any. While GdViewer1.PdfSearchText(GdViewer1.CurrentPage, Text, Occurrence, false, Left, Top, Width, Height) GdViewer1.AddRegion(("MyRegion" + Occurrence.ToString), Left, Top, Width, Height, System.Windows.Media.Color.FromArgb(255, 255, 255, 0), GdViewer.RegionFillMode.Multiply) Occurrence += 1 End While

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfSearchText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches the current page of the displayed PDF for a given text string.
member.param: The text to search for.
The occurrence of the text to search for. Set 0 to search and highlight all occurrences found else 1 to search for the first occurrence, 2 for the second...
True to apply case-sensitive search, else False.
Searches for whole words only.
member.returns: True if the string has been found, else False.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

code.description: Searches the current page for a string and highlight the result

example.code: Dim Text As String = "PDF" Dim Occurrence As Integer = 1 Dim Left As Double = 0 Dim Top As Double = 0 Dim Width As Double = 0 Dim Height As Double = 0 GdViewer1.RemoveAllRegions 'remove previously added regions, if any. While GdViewer1.PdfSearchText(GdViewer1.CurrentPage, Text, Occurrence, false, Left, Top, Width, Height) GdViewer1.AddRegion(("MyRegion" + Occurrence.ToString), Left, Top, Width, Height, System.Windows.Media.Color.FromArgb(255, 255, 255, 0), GdViewer.RegionFillMode.Multiply) Occurrence += 1 End While

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfSearchText(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Searches a specific page of the displayed PDF for an occurrence of a given text string and returns its bounding box.
member.param: The page to search.
The text to search for.
The occurrence of the text to search for. 1 to search for the first occurrence, 2 for the second... 0 is not accepted.
True to apply case-sensitive search, else False.
If the occurrence is found, returns the left position in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the top position in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the width in inches of the area covering the text.
If the occurrence is found, returns the height in inches of the area covering the text.
member.returns: True if the string has been found, else False.
member.remarks: Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.summary: Searches a specific page of the displayed PDF for an occurrence of a given text string and returns its bounding box.

1: Pages / Frames

4: Pages / Frames || Goto Next
5: Pages / Frames || Goto Last
100: Play Gif
200: Stop Gif Animation
300: Rotations

705: Mouse Mode || Magnifier Tool
800: ViewerQuality

802: ViewerQuality || Medium
803: ViewerQuality || High

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.CopyRegionToClipboard(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies a region of the displayed document into the Clipboard.

The top source pixel.
Width of the region in pixel.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.CopyRegionToGdPictureImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies a region of the displayed document into a GdPicture Image.
member.param: The left source pixel.
The top source pixel.
Width of the region in pixel.
Height of the region in pixel.
member.returns: 0: The image could not be created. failed. Non-zero: GdPicture Image Identifier. The created image.

remarks.para: The exported GdPicture Image must be released from the memory by the user using the ReleaseGdPictureImage() method.
Use the GetStat() method to determine if this method failed.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.AddRegion(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Windows.Media.Color,GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.RegionFillMode)
member.summary: Adds a region on the current page of the displayed document.
member.param: The name of the region. Can be an empty string.
Left position, in inches, of the region on the page.
Top position, in inches, of the region on the page.
Width, in inches, of the region on the page.
Height, in inches, of the region on the page.
Color used to fill the region.
The fill mode of the region. A member of the RegionFillMode enumeration.
member.returns: The ID of the added region.
member.remarks: To convert pixels to inches, the horizontal values (left, width) should be divided by PageHorizontalResolution, and the vertical values (right, height) should be divided by PageVerticalResolution.

code.description: Searches the current page for a string and highlight the result

example.code: Dim Text As String = "PDF" Dim Occurrence As Integer = 1 Dim Left As Double = 0 Dim Top As Double = 0 Dim Width As Double = 0 Dim Height As Double = 0 GdViewer1.RemoveAllRegions 'remove previously added regions, if any. While GdViewer1.PdfSearchText(GdViewer1.CurrentPage, Text, Occurrence, false, Left, Top, Width, Height) GdViewer1.AddRegion(("MyRegion" + Occurrence.ToString), Left, Top, Width, Height, System.Windows.Media.Color.FromArgb(255, 255, 255, 0), GdViewer.RegionFillMode.Multiply) Occurrence += 1 End While

member.param: The paper bin to use.Standard values are: - 1: Upper - 2: Lower - 3: Middle - 4: Manual - 5: Envelope - 6: ManualFeed - 7: AutomaticFeed - 8: TractorFeed - 9: SmallFormat - 10: LargeFormat - 11: LargeCapacity - 14: Cassette - 15: FormSource - 256 or higher: Custom.
member.returns: True if the paper bin has been selected else false (unsupported paper bin).

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PrintGetPaperBin
member.summary: Returns the paperbin used by the active printer.
member.returns: The paperbin used. Standard values are: - 1: Upper - 2: Lower - 3: Middle - 4: Manual - 5: Envelope - 6: ManualFeed - 7: AutomaticFeed - 8: TractorFeed - 9: SmallFormat - 10: LargeFormat - 11: LargeCapacity - 14: Cassette - 15: FormSource - 256 or higher: Custom

Last page to print.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PrintSetPageSelection(System.String)
member.summary: Ask to the component for the next print process to print a selection of pages.
member.param: The custom page range. For example "1;4;5" to print pages 1, 4 and 5 or "1-5;10" to print pages from 1 to 5 and page 10. Use * to print all pages.
member.remarks: This method is not compatible with PrintDialog() and PrintDialogFit().

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.EnableTextSelection
member.summary: Specifies if text selection is enabled. Holding Alt key during selection permits to switch to column selection mode instead of the default line selection mode. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.AnimateGIF
member.summary: Specifies if by default the viewer must animate loaded multiframe GIF images. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfRasterizerEngine
member.summary: Defines the rasterizer engine to use for PDF rendering purposes. Default value is PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineHybrid.

member.summary: Get or set the bitmap effect to apply to the rendered page.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.AnnotationEffect
member.summary: Get or set the bitmap effect to apply to the GdPicture/XMP annotations.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.AllowDropFile
member.summary: Specifies if the user is able to drop files from the explorer to the control. Default value is false.
member.remarks: When set to true and when file is dropped within the viewer the DropFile event is raised.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.EnableICM
member.summary: Specifies if color correction is used for document embedding an icc profile. False by default.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.HorizontalScrollBarVisible
member.summary: Returns if the horizontal scrollbar is visible or not.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.VerticalScrollBarVisible
member.summary: Returns if the vertical scrollbar is visible or not.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfShowDialogForPassword
member.summary: If the PDF to open is protected, the control will prompt the user for a password. Turn this property to False to use your own dialog box (you will have to catch the PDFPasswordRequest event). Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfEnableFileLinks
member.summary: PDF documents are often designed to contain links to other PDF. Such option is usually provided through a GoToR action handled by special objects such as bookmarks and form field links. This property turned to True allows the viewer to automatically navigates to the linked document, if any. Such action can be performed when the user clicks a node of a linked BookmarkTree object or a form field on the Viewer. The PdfFileNavigation event is fired before displaying the new document. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfVerifyDigitalCertificates
member.summary: Specifies if the viewer is responsible to check digital certificate when rendering a PDF document containing a digital signature. Depending on the outcome of the certificate audit, the visible appearances associated to each digital signature could be adjusted. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.Cursor
member.summary: The cursor that appears when the pointer moves over the viewer. It is recommended to not use this method.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.ScrollBars
member.summary: Specifies if scrollbars can be displayed or not within the viewer. If true, scrollbars appears when the area to render is larger than the control. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.ForceScrollBars
member.summary: Turn this property to True to force the viewer to always displaying scrollbars. Default value is False.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.EnableMenu
member.summary: To enable or disable the viewer contextual menu. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.Zoom

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.ZoomMax

member.summary: Current page of the displayed document. (Starts from 1).

member.summary: Zoom mode used by the viewer. Default value is ViewerZoomMode.ZoomMode100.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.EnableMouseWheel
member.summary: Specifies whether the object can change zoom during to the mouse Wheel events. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DocumentAlignment
member.summary: Default image alignment within the viewer when the area of the viewer if smaller than the displayed document in its current zoom configuration. Setting this property to DocumentAlignmentTopLeft has the effect to display the most top-left part of the displayed page during "Zoom In" operations. Default value is ViewerDocumentAlignment.DocumentAlignmentMiddleCenter.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.DocumentPosition
member.summary: Default page position within the viewer when the rendering area of the displayed document in its current zoom configuration if smaller than then area of the viewer. Default value is ViewerDocumentPosition.DocumentPositionMiddleCenter.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.BitmapScalingMode
member.summary: Defines the bitmap scaling mode used for page rendering. Default value is BitmapScalingMode.HighQuality.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfDisplayFormField
member.summary: Specifies if the viewer renders form fields included into PDF. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfEnableLinks
member.summary: By default, if a hyperlink of a PDF document is clicked, the control will follow the link. Turn this property to False to disable this behavior. Default value is True.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PdfIncreaseTextContrast
member.summary: Specifies if the rendering engine should increase text contrast on low zoom in order to enhance readability. This feature can decrease rendering speed performances on old machines. Default value is false.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.MouseWheelMode
member.summary: Defines the Mouse Wheel method. Default value is ViewerMouseWheelMode.MouseWheelModeZoom.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.MouseButtonForMouseMode

member.name: E:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.BeforeAnnotationAddedByUser
member.summary: Occurs when a GdPicture/XMP annotation has been added by the user. Bubble routing strategy. This event occurs in mouse down action, therefore it can be particularly useful to change some properties of the new annotation to add before rendering it to the screen. See example.

code.description: Catch the BeforeAnnotationAddedByUser event to modify the background color of the new added sticky-note annotations.

example.code: Private Sub GdViewer1_AnnotationAddedByUser(ByVal AnnotationIdx As Integer) Handles GdViewer1.BeforeAnnotationAddedByUser Dim annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(AnnotationIdx) If TypeOf annot Is AnnotationStickyNote Then DirectCast(annot, AnnotationStickyNote).FillColor = Color.Beige GdViewer1.DisplayTextEditBox(AnnotationIdx) End If

member.name: E:GdPicture12.WPF.GdViewer.PreviewBeforeAnnotationAddedByUser
member.summary: Occurs when a GdPicture/XMP annotation has been added by the user. Tunnel routing strategy. This event occurs in mouse down action, therefore it can be particularly useful to change some properties of the new annotation to add before rendering it to the screen. See example.

code.description: Catch the BeforeAnnotationAddedByUser event to modify the background color of the new added sticky-note annotations.

example.code: Private Sub GdViewer1_AnnotationAddedByUser(ByVal AnnotationIdx As Integer) Handles GdViewer1.BeforeAnnotationAddedByUser Dim annot As GdPicture.Annotation = GdViewer1.GetAnnotationFromIdx(AnnotationIdx) If TypeOf annot Is AnnotationStickyNote Then DirectCast(annot, AnnotationStickyNote).FillColor = Color.Beige GdViewer1.DisplayTextEditBox(AnnotationIdx) End If

member.name: P:GdPicture12.WPF.BookmarksTree.DisableZoomDestination
member.summary: The PDF format specifies a parameter that allow to define a zoom level for a bookmark's page destination. Turning this property to True permits to ignore this information. Otherwise, the GdViewer object associated to the BookmarkTree will adjust the zoom accordingly. Default value is False.

member.name: T:GdPicture12.PdfRasterizerEngine
member.summary: Defines the Microsoft Windows application programming interface used to render PDF documents.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineGdiplus
member.summary:
GdiPlus.
Pros: very fast path painting. Low memory usage.
Cons: uses internal lock which considerably decreased performances when used in multiple threads. Slow image rendering.
Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineWPF
member.summary:
Windows Presentation Foundation.
Pros: support antialiasing in clipping path. Fast image rendering. Produces very high performances in multithreaded applications.
Cons: slower path painting than GdiPlus. Requires more memory than GdiPlus.
Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfRasterizerEngine.PdfRasterizerEngineHybrid
member.summary: This engine mix all supported programming interfaces in order to favor rendering quality, speed, and multitread performances. Member value is 65535.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeUnknown
member.summary: Unknown mask mode. Member value is -1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeNone
member.summary: Standard bitmap without masking operation. Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeStencil
member.summary: A monochrome image in which each sample is specified by a single bit. However, instead of being painted in opaque black and white, the image mask is treated as a stencil mask that is partly opaque and partly transparent. Sample values in the image do not represent black and white pixels; rather, they designate places on the page that should either be marked with the current color or masked out (not marked at all). Areas that are masked out retain their former contents. The effect is like applying paint in the current color through a cut-out stencil, which lets the paint reach the page in some places and masks it out in others. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeExplicit
member.summary: In PDF 1.3, the Mask entry in an image dictionary may be an image mask, as described above under Stencil Masking, which serves as an explicit mask for the primary (base) image. The base image and the image mask need not have the same resolution (Width and Height values), but since all images are defined on the unit square in user space, their boundaries on the page will coincide; that is, they will overlay each other. The image mask indicates which places on the page are to be painted and which are to be masked out (left unchanged). Unmasked areas are painted with the corresponding portions of the base image; masked areas are not. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeSoft
member.summary: Defines the Alpha channel to be applyed to another image. Member value is 3.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfImageMaskType.PdfMaskTypeColorKey
member.summary: In PDF 1.3, the Mask entry in an image dictionary may alternatively be an array specifying a range of colors to be masked out. Samples in the image that fall within this range are not painted, allowing the existing background to show through. The effect is similar to that of the video technique known as chroma-key. Member value is 4.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceHideToolbar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications tool bars when the document is active. Default value: false. Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceHideMenubar
member.summary: /(Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer applications menu bar when the document is active. Default value: false. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceHideWindowUI
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the documents window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the documents contents displayed. Default value: false. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceFitWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to resize the documents window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default value: false. Member value is 3.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceCenterWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to position the documents window in the center of the screen. Default value: false. Member value is 4.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfViewerPreference.PdfViewerPreferenceDisplayDocTitle
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A flag specifying whether the windows title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary (see Section 10.2.1, Document Information Dictionary). If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file containing the document. Default value: false. Member value is 5.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagDefault
member.summary: Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagInvisible
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the standard annotation types and no annotation handler is available. If clear, display such an unknown annotation using an appearance stream specified by its appearance dictionary, if any. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagHidden
member.summary: (PDF 1.2) If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with the user, regardless of its annotation type or whether an annotation handler is available. In cases where screen space is limited, the ability to hide and show annotations selectively can be used in combination with appearance streams. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagPrint
member.summary: (PDF 1.2) If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen. This can be useful, for example, for annotations representing interactive pushbuttons, which would serve no meaningful purpose on the printed page. Member value is 4.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagNoZoom
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not scale the annotations appearance to match the magnification of the page. The location of the annotation on the page (defined by the upper-left corner of its annotation rectangle) remains fixed, regardless of the page magnification. See below for further discussion. Member value is 8.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagNoRotate
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not rotate the annotations appearance to match the rotation of the page. The upper-left corner of the annotation rectangle remains in a fixed location on the page, regardless of the page rotation. See below for further discussion. Member value is 16.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagNoView
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the setting of the Print flag) but should be considered hidden for purposes of on-screen display and user interaction. Member value is 32.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagReadOnly
member.summary: (PDF 1.3) If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user. The annotation may be displayed or printed (depending on the settings of the NoView and Print flags) but should not respond to mouse clicks or change its appearance in response to mouse motions. Note: This flag is ignored for widget annotations; its function is subsumed by the ReadOnly flag of the associated form field Member value is 64.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagLocked
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to the annotations contents, such as the value of a form field. Member value is 128.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagToggleNoView
F:GdPicture12.PdfAnnotationFlag.PdfAnnotationFlagLockedContents
member.summary: (PDF 1.7) If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties, such as position and size. Member value is 512.

member.summary: (PDF 1.5) Updates the display of a document, using a transition dictionary. Member value is 16.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfActionType.ActionTypeGoTo3DView
member.summary: (PDF 1.6) Set the current view of a 3D annotation Member value is 17.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfActionType.ActionTypeExplicitDestination
member.summary: Specifies a destination explicitly in a PDF file. Member value is 128.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeUndefined
member.summary: Member value is -1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeXYZ
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value. Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFit
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. Member value is 3.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitR
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and topentirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the rectangle within the window in the other dimension. A null value for any of the parameters may result in unpredictable behavior. Member value is 4.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitB
member.summary: (PDF 1.1) Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension. Member value is 5.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitBH
member.summary: (PDF 1.1) Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. Member value is 6.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfDestinationType.DestinationTypeFitBV
member.summary: (PDF 1.1) Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. Member value is 7.

member.name: T:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace
member.summary: Specifies a color space.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceUnknown
member.summary: Unknown color space. Member value is -1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceDeviceGray
member.summary: Controls the intensity of achromatic light, on a scale from black to white. Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceDeviceRGB
member.summary: Controls the intensities of red, green, and blue light, the three additive primary colors used in displays. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceDeviceCMYK
member.summary: Controls the concentrations of cyan, magenta, yellow, and black inks, the four subtractive process colors used in printing. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceCalGray
member.summary: Special case of a single-component CIE-based color space, known as a CIE-based A color space. Member value is 3.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceCalRGB
member.summary: Specifies a CIE-based ABC color space with only one transformation stage instead of two. Member value is 4.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceLab
member.summary: Specifies a CIE-based ABC color space with two transformation stages. Member value is 5.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceICCBased
member.summary: Specifies a color space based on a cross-platform color profile as defined by the International Color Consortium (ICC). Member value is 6.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceIndexed
member.summary: An Indexed color space allows a PDF content stream to use small integers as indices into a color map or color table of arbitrary colors in some other space. Member value is 7.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpacePattern
member.summary: A Pattern color space (PDF 1.2) enables a PDF content stream to paint an area with a pattern rather than a single color. Member value is 8.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceSeparation
member.summary: A Separation color space (PDF 1.2) provides a means for specifying the use of additional colorants or for isolating the control of individual color components of a device color space for a subtractive device. Member value is 9.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfColorSpace.PdfColorSpaceDeviceN
member.summary: DeviceN color spaces (PDF 1.3) can contain an arbitrary number of color components. They provide greater flexibility than is possible with standard device color spaces such as DeviceCMYK or with individual Separation color spaces. Member value is 10.

member.name: T:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode
member.summary: Defines the blend function used in the compositing formula to customize the blending operation.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeNormal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop. Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeMultiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values. The result color is always at least as dark as either of the two constituent colors. Multiplying any color with black produces black; multiplying with white leaves the original color unchanged. Painting successive overlapping objects with a color other than black or white produces progressively darker colors. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeScreen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result. The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors. Screening any color with white produces white; screening with black leaves the original color unchanged. The effect is similar to projecting multiple photographic slides simultaneously onto a single screen. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeOverLay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop. Member value is 3.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeDarken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is darker; otherwise, it is left unchanged. Member value is 4.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeLighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors. The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged. Member value is 5.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes. Member value is 6.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change. Member value is 7.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeHardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop. Member value is 8.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeSoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop. Member value is 9.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeDifference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change. Member value is 10.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeExclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change. Member value is 11.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeHue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color. Member value is 12.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeSaturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change. Member value is 13.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeColor
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images. Member value is 14.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfBlendMode.PdfBlendModeLuminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode. Member value is 15.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfLineCapStyle.PdfLineCapStyleButt
member.summary: Butt cap. The stroke is squared off at the endpoint of the path. There is no projection beyond the end of the path. Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfLineCapStyle.PdfLineCapStyleRound
member.summary: Round cap. A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the endpoint and filled in. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfLineCapStyle.PdfLineCapStyleProjectingSquare
member.summary: Projecting square cap. The stroke continues beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and is squared off. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfLineJoinStyle.PdfLineJoinStyleMiter
member.summary: The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the miter limit parameter), a bevel join is used instead. Member value is 0.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfLineJoinStyle.PdfLineJoinStyleRound
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pieslice-shaped figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfLineJoinStyle.PdfLineJoinStyleBevel
member.summary: The two segments are finished with butt caps and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle. Member value is 2.

member.name: T:GdPicture12.PdfPortFolioType
member.summary: initial view for the portfolio

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfPortFolioType.Detail
member.summary: The collection view is presented in details mode, with all information in the Schema dictionary presented in a multi-column format. This mode provides the most information to the user.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfPortFolioType.Tile
member.summary: The collection view is presented in tile mode, with each file in the collection denoted by a small icon and a subset of information from the Schema dictionary. This mode provides top-level information about the file attachments to the user.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.PdfPortFolioType.Hiden
member.summary: The collection view is initially hidden, without preventing the user from obtaining a file list via explicit action

member.name: F:GdPicture12.BitonalReduction.NearestColor
member.summary: Each pixel value is compared against a fixed threshold. This may be the simplest dithering algorithm there is, but it results in immense loss of detail and contouring. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.BitonalReduction.OrderedDither
member.summary: Produces a cross-hatch pattern. This is a form of dispersed dithering. Because the dots don't cluster, the result looks much less grainy. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.BitonalReduction.Burke
member.summary: A simplified form of Stucki dithering that is faster, but less clean than Stucki dithering. Member value is 3.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.BitonalReduction.Stucki
member.summary: Based on Floyd Steinberg, but is slightly faster. Its output tends to be clean and sharp. Member value is 4.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.BitonalReduction.FloydSteinberg
member.summary: Only diffuses the error to neighbouring pixels. This results in very fine-grained dithering. Member value is 5.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeBLACK
member.summary: Pixel is always 0. Member value is 1.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOTMERGEPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the ForegroundMixModeMERGEPEN color. Member value is 2.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMASKNOTPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the inverse of the screen. Member value is 3.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOTCOPYPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the pen color. Member value is 4.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMASKPENNOT
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the inverse of the screen. Member value is 5.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOT
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the screen color. Member value is 6.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeXORPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the colors in the pen and in the screen, but not in both. Member value is 7.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOTMASKPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the ForegroundMixModeMASKPEN color. Member value is 8.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMASKPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the screen. Member value is 9.

member.summary: Pixel is the inverse of the R2_XORPEN color. Member value is 10.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeNOP
member.summary: Pixel remains unchanged. Member value is 11.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMERGENOTPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the screen color and the inverse of the pen color. Member value is 12.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeCOPYPEN
member.summary: Pixel is the pen color. Member value is 13.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMERGEPENNOT
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the screen color. Member value is 14.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.ForegroundMixMode.ForegroundMixModeMERGEPEN
member.summary: Pixel is a combination of the pen color and the screen color. Member value is 15.

member.name: M:GdPicture12.Internal.Geometry.GeometryUtils.compareBaseLine(GdPicture12.Internal.Globals.GdPictureRectF,GdPicture12.Internal.Globals.GdPictureRectF)
member.summary: This method tries to determine if two boxes are located on the same line in the context of text extraction. Origin is considered as top-left.

member.name: T:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.FontTrueTypehheaTable
member.summary: The 'hhea' table contains information needed to layout fonts whose characters are written horizontally, that is, either left to right or right to left. This table contains information that is general to the font as a whole. Information which pertains to specific glyphs is given in the 'hmtx' table.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.FontTrueTypehheaTable.version
member.summary: Fixed version 0x00010000 (1.0).

member.name: F:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.FontTrueTypehheaTable.Ascender
member.summary: FWord ascent Distance from baseline of highest ascender.

member.summary: FWord descent Distance from baseline of lowest descender.

member.name: F:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.FontTrueTypehheaTable.LineGap
member.summary: FWord lineGap typographic line gap.

member.summary: FWord minLeftSideBearing must be consistent with horizontal metrics.

member.summary: FWord minRightSideBearing must be consistent with horizontal metrics.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the strikeout stroke, in design units, of this font.

member.summary: Specifies the size (commonly called em size or em height), in design units, of this font.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.LineSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing, in design units, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. The value is computed using the formula: LineSpacing = Ascent + Math.Abs(Descent) + LineGap.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.WinLineSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing, computed for Windows, in design units, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. The value is computed using the formula: LineSpacing = Ascent + Math.Abs(Descent) + LineGap.
member.remarks: Win Ascent and Win Descent are supposed to be the Windows metrics, while Ascender and Descender are supposed to be the Apple metrics, but in the case of line spacing, Microsoft has decided to look at both, and pick the larger value when returning Line Spacing calculation. ref: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms533824(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: P:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.WinExternalLeading
member.summary: Specifies the line external leading, computed for Windows, in design units, of this font. The formula is WinExternalLeading = LineSpacing - (WinAscent + WinDescent).

member.name: P:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.LineGap
member.summary: Specifies the typographic line gap, in design units, of this font.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.Internal.Fonts.TrueType.FontTrueTypeParser.TypoLineGap
member.summary: Specifies the typo line gap, in design units, of this font.

member.summary: Specifies the font Style.

member.name: P:GdPicture12.Internal.Imaging.GdPictureImage.Photometric
member.summary: Returns the photometric of the image. 0 = WhiteIsZero. For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as white. 1 = BlackIsZero.For bilevel and grayscale images: 0 is imaged as black. 2 = RGB.RGB value of(0,0,0) represents black, and (255, 255, 255) represents white, assuming 8-bit components.The components are stored in the indicated order: first Red, then Green, then Blue. 3 = Palette color.

member.name: T:GdPicture12.Internal.Utils.StreamUtils.BitStreamReader
member.summary: A stream-style reader for retrieving packed bits from a byte array. Ref: http://referencesource.microsoft.com/#PresentationCore/Shared/MS/Internal/Ink/BitStream.cs,6a7d84e516b71ab0
member.remarks: This bits should packed into the leftmost position in each byte. For compatibility purposes with the v1 ISF encoder and decoder, the order of the packing must not be changed. This code is a from-scratch rewrite of the BitStream natice C++ class in the v1 Ink code, but still maintaining the same packing behavior.

member.summary: Create a new BitStreamReader to unpack the bits in a buffer of bytes and enforce a maximum buffer read length

Maximum number of bytes to read from the buffer

member.summary: Read a specified number of bits from the stream into a single byte
member.param: The number of bits to unpack
member.returns: A single byte that contains up to 8 packed bits
member.remarks: For example, if 2 bits are read from the stream, then a full byte will be created with the least significant bits set to the 2 unpacked bits from the stream

member.summary: Since the return value of Read cannot distinguish between valid and invalid data (e.g. 8 bits set), the EndOfStream property detects when there is no more data to read.
member.value: True if stream end has been reached

member.summary: The current read index in the array

member.name: T:GdPicture12.Internal.Utils.StreamUtils.BitStreamWriter
member.summary: A stream-like writer for packing bits into a byte buffer. Ref: http://referencesource.microsoft.com/#PresentationCore/Shared/MS/Internal/Ink/BitStream.cs,6a7d84e516b71ab0
member.remarks: This class is to be used with the BitStreamReader for reading and writing bytes. Note that the bytes should be read in the same order and lengths as they were written to retrieve the same values. See remarks in BitStreamReader regarding compatibility with the native C++ BitStream class.
